In your code, you are using the `DataOutputStream.writeBytes()` method to send the text data. This method writes the bytes of the given string to the output stream. However, it does not handle emojis correctly because emojis are represented by multiple bytes in UTF-8 encoding.

To send the text data along with emojis correctly, you need to use the `DataOutputStream.write()` method instead. This method writes a single byte to the output stream. To send the text data as UTF-8 encoded bytes, you can use the `String.getBytes("UTF-8")` method to convert the string to bytes and then write each byte individually using the `write()` method.

Here is an example of how to modify your code to send the text data correctly:

```
private void buildTextPart(DataOutputStream dataOutputStream, String parameterName, String parameterValue) throws IOException {
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(twoHyphens + boundary + lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes("Content-Disposition: form-data; name="");
    dataOutputStream.write(parameterName.getBytes("UTF-8"));
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes("Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8" + lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);

    byte[] parameterBytes = parameterValue.getBytes("UTF-8");
    for (byte b : parameterBytes) {
        dataOutputStream.write(b);
    }

    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);
}
```

By using the `write()` method to write each byte individually, the emojis will be sent correctly without being converted to other characters.
